message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CC. 

The paper proposes a new approach for neural question answering (QA) that involves an additional answer re-ranking stage. This falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML), which are both subfields of computer science. Specifically, the paper focuses on content-based QA, which involves retrieving relevant text passages and using a neural network for machine comprehension to extract the answer. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). Of these, cs.CL and cs.IR are the most likely categories, as they are directly related to NLP and information retrieval, which are key components of the proposed approach. cs.AI and cs.LG are also likely categories, as they are broader subfields of ML that encompass NLP and other related areas. cs.CC is less likely, as it is focused on the theoretical aspects of computation and complexity, which are not the main focus of the paper.
